grant_name: Grants for civil society organisations that support Ukrainians in times of war
eligibility_criteria: Officially registered Ukrainian non-profit organizations (types 0032, 0034, 0036, 0038, 0039, 0048) with project implementation experience
focus_areas: Emergency response, humanitarian aid, civil society support during war
grant_amount: Up to €10,000 per project (paid in UAH at NBU exchange rate)
detailed_description: Enhanced program information for EU4CSOs Emergency Actions Grants. This grant from EU/Network 100 percent life Rivne provides funding opportunities for eligible organizations. Visit the official website for complete details and current application requirements.
application_procedure: Send complete document package to eu4csosemergencyactions@gmail.com with subject line "Конкурс суб-грантів в рамках проєкту EU4CSOs Emergency Actions". Applications accepted until 29th of each month. Expert commission decides on 30th or 31st of each month. Results sent via email.
required_documents: Completed application form (in Ukrainian), Project budget in specific form, Certificate with bank account details
additional_requirements: Must be officially registered Ukrainian non-profit organization with specific non-profit types: 0032, 0034, 0036, 0038, 0039, 0048. Must have project implementation experience. Up to six months to implement project.
language_requirements: Applications accepted in English and Ukrainian. All supporting documents must be translated if in other languages.
reporting_requirements: Project reporting required (specific details provided upon award)
evaluation_criteria: Expert commission evaluation (no public justification of decisions provided, no individual feedback to applicants). Focus on support for people affected by war, project implementation experience required.

focus_areas: Women's rights, trans rights, sex worker rights, feminist activism
detailed_description: Mama Cash Ukraine Support provides funding to women, girls, trans and intersex people in their fight for their rights. They offer multiple funding streams including Radical Love Fund, Resilience Fund, Revolution Fund, Solidarity Fund, and Spark Fund to support feminist movements and gender justice initiatives.
application_procedure: Apply through Mama Cash online application system. Different funds have specific application periods and procedures. Initial concept notes followed by full proposals for selected applicants. Check website for current funding rounds and deadlines.
required_documents: Application requirements include: Organization profile and feminist mission, Project proposal with clear objectives, Budget breakdown and justification, Impact measurement plan, Letters of support, Registration documentation
additional_requirements: Must be women, girls, trans or intersex-led organization or initiative. Clear commitment to feminist values and gender justice required. Priority given to grassroots organizations and movements in Global South.
language_requirements: Applications accepted in English and Ukrainian. All supporting documents must be translated if in other languages.
reporting_requirements: Regular progress reports, financial accountability documentation, impact assessment reports, final evaluation with lessons learned, contribution to feminist movement documentation
evaluation_criteria: Applications evaluated on: Alignment with feminist movement priorities, Potential for gender justice impact, Organizational capacity and experience, Innovation in approach, Sustainability and long-term vision, Intersectional analysis
eligibility_criteria_uk: Феміністичні організації під керівництвом жінок, дівчат, транс та інтерсекс людей

additional_requirements: Must be working on education access, quality, or system strengthening. Organizations should have demonstrated experience in education sector. Projects must show potential for meaningful impact on educational outcomes.
language_requirements: Applications accepted in English and Ukrainian. All supporting documents must be translated if in other languages.
reporting_requirements: Quarterly progress reports with education metrics, financial accountability documentation, impact assessment with student and teacher feedback, annual evaluation reviews, final comprehensive report with lessons learned
evaluation_criteria: Applications evaluated on: Alignment with education improvement goals, Evidence-based approach and innovation, Organizational capacity in education sector, Potential for scalable impact, Cost-effectiveness and value for money, Sustainability and long-term vision

detailed_description: Committee to Protect Journalists (CPJ) is a nonprofit organization that defends the right of journalists to report news safely without fear of reprisal. They provide emergency assistance, prison support grants, safety information, and advocacy for press freedom worldwide.
application_procedure: Emergency assistance available through CPJ Get Help portal at cpj.org/emergency-response/how-to-get-help/. Submit request describing situation and immediate needs. Rapid response assessment for urgent cases involving journalist safety or legal threats.
required_documents: Emergency assistance requests require: Description of situation and immediate threat, Journalist identity verification, Supporting documentation of incident, Contact information, Urgency level assessment
additional_requirements: Must be working journalist or immediate family member. Cases must involve press freedom violations, imprisonment, or safety threats related to journalistic work. Emergency situations prioritized.
language_requirements: Applications accepted in English and Ukrainian. All supporting documents must be translated if in other languages.
reporting_requirements: Case status updates, safety situation reports, assistance outcome documentation, follow-up safety assessments, advocacy impact reporting
evaluation_criteria: Assistance evaluated on: Immediate safety threat level, Journalist identity verification, Case urgency and timeline, Available resources and capacity, Potential for successful intervention

grant_name: House of Europe International Cooperation Grants (Autumn 2025 Call)
eligibility_criteria: Public non-profit organizations in the culture and creative industries registered in Ukraine or an EU country. Applicants should demonstrate relevant experience and a project portfolio. Collaboration between Ukrainian and EU/UK organizations is required.
focus_areas: Cultural exchanges and collaborative projects between Ukrainian and EU/UK organizations. This can include music festivals, virtual exhibitions, book fairs, digital residencies, theatrical plays, and conferences. Priority is given to impactful and timely initiatives, projects involving digital technologies, and those engaging Ukrainian audiences.
grant_amount: Up to €50,000. Covers staff costs, service costs (artistic honorariums, translation, design, production), administration costs (rent, equipment, consumables), and travel costs. Does not cover ongoing organizational costs or purchase/renovation of equipment.
application_deadline: Autumn 2025. Specific dates are announced on the House of Europe website and newsletter. The Spring 2025 call deadline has likely passed.
detailed_description: Cultural exchanges and collaborative projects between Ukrainian and EU/UK organizations. This can include music festivals, virtual exhibitions, book fairs, digital residencies, theatrical plays, and conferences. Priority is given to impactful and timely initiatives, projects involving digital technologies, and those engaging Ukrainian audiences.
language_requirements: The House of Europe website is available in English and Ukrainian. Translation into Ukrainian is required for projects targeting Ukrainian audiences. Application language not explicitly stated for the form itself, but likely English or Ukrainian.

detailed_description: Sigrid Rausing Trust is a London-based grant-making foundation established in 1995 with over £300 million endowment. They have supported over 950 organizations worldwide with £591 million in committed grants, focusing on Human Rights and Rule of Law, Open Societies, Environment, and special gift programs.
application_procedure: IMPORTANT: The Trust does not accept unsolicited applications. Organizations are selected through proactive identification and invitation by Trust staff. Potential grantees are approached directly based on strategic alignment with Trust priorities.
required_documents: For invited applications: Organizational profile and mission alignment, Project proposal with clear objectives, Budget breakdown and financial projections, Impact measurement framework, Organizational registration documents, Previous impact reports
additional_requirements: Organizations must be working in human rights, social justice, environmental issues, or open society initiatives. Invitation-only application process. No unsolicited applications accepted.
language_requirements: Applications accepted in English and Ukrainian. All supporting documents must be translated if in other languages.
reporting_requirements: Detailed annual reports, financial accountability documentation, impact assessment with metrics, final evaluation reports, regular communication with Trust staff, contribution to field knowledge
evaluation_criteria: Selection based on: Strategic alignment with Trust focus areas, Organizational effectiveness and track record, Innovation and potential for systemic change, Geographic and thematic priorities, Leadership quality, Long-term sustainability

focus_areas: Democratic practice, sustainable development, peacebuilding
detailed_description: Rockefeller Brothers Fund Central and Eastern Europe (CEE) program supports democratic development, civil society strengthening, and social justice initiatives in Central and Eastern European countries. They focus on promoting democratic institutions, human rights, and sustainable development in the region.
application_procedure: Contact RBF program officers for initial discussions about funding alignment. No open application process - grants made through proactive identification and relationship building. Submit initial inquiry outlining organization and project alignment with RBF priorities.
required_documents: For initial discussions: Organization profile and mission, Project concept and alignment with RBF priorities, Organizational track record and capacity, Leadership and team information, Regional context and impact potential, Financial overview
additional_requirements: Must be working on democratic development, civil society strengthening, or social justice in Central and Eastern Europe. Strong preference for organizations with regional expertise and local partnerships. No unsolicited proposals accepted.
target_beneficiaries: CSOs in Central and Eastern Europe
language_requirements: Applications accepted in English and Ukrainian. All supporting documents must be translated if in other languages.
reporting_requirements: Annual progress reports, financial accountability documentation, impact assessment with democratic development indicators, regional analysis and context updates, final evaluation with lessons learned
evaluation_criteria: Funding decisions based on: Alignment with democratic development goals, Organizational effectiveness and leadership, Potential for systemic change in CEE region, Innovation and strategic approach, Sustainability and long-term impact, Regional expertise and relationships

detailed_description: Foundation for a Just Society (FJS) supports organizations working to advance social justice, human rights, and democratic values. They provide funding to civil society organizations that work on systemic change and address root causes of inequality and injustice.
application_procedure: Submit inquiries through FJS website or direct contact with program staff. Initial concept notes reviewed before full proposal invitations. Application process varies by program area and geographic focus. Regular funding cycles with specific deadlines.
required_documents: Application materials include: Organizational profile and mission statement, Project proposal with social justice focus, Budget narrative and justification, Work plan and timeline, Impact measurement strategy, Registration and tax documents
additional_requirements: Must be legitimate civil society organization focused on social justice. Projects should address systemic inequality, human rights, or democratic governance. Compliance with foundation policies and donor regulations required.
language_requirements: Applications accepted in English and Ukrainian. All supporting documents must be translated if in other languages.
reporting_requirements: Semi-annual progress reports, annual financial reports, impact assessment documentation, final project evaluation, lessons learned and best practices sharing
evaluation_criteria: Proposals evaluated on: Alignment with social justice mission, Potential for systemic impact, Organizational effectiveness, Innovation in approach, Sustainability and long-term vision, Leadership and capacity

evaluation_criteria: Applications evaluated on: Alignment with Oak Foundation priorities, Potential for meaningful impact, Organizational effectiveness and capacity, Innovation and evidence-based approach, Sustainability and long-term vision, Collaboration and partnership potential

detailed_description: Luminate Foundation is a global foundation focused on enabling civic and political participation, challenging power structures, and ensuring access to accurate information. They work primarily in Africa, Asia, and Latin America with a flexible approach to creating impact through funding and collaboration.
application_procedure: Review Luminate funding process on their website before applying. Contact through their official contact page for initial inquiries. Funding approach is flexible and varies by region and focus area. Regular funding cycles with ongoing partnership development.
required_documents: Funding applications require: Organization overview and mission alignment, Project proposal with clear objectives, Budget breakdown and sustainability plan, Impact measurement framework, Team and organizational capacity information, Letters of support
additional_requirements: Focus on organizations in Africa, Asia, and Latin America. Projects must align with civic participation, challenging power structures, or ensuring information access. Strong preference for local and regional organizations.
language_requirements: Applications accepted in English and Ukrainian. All supporting documents must be translated if in other languages.
reporting_requirements: Regular progress updates, financial accountability reports, impact measurement documentation, annual partnership reviews, final evaluation with lessons learned and systemic impact assessment
evaluation_criteria: Applications evaluated on: Alignment with Luminate priorities (civic participation, power structures, information access), Innovation and effectiveness, Organizational capacity, Geographic focus alignment, Potential for systemic change, Sustainability

detailed_description: Adessium Foundation strengthens initiatives that contribute to a free, sustainable and just society in the Netherlands and Europe. In 2024, they donated €16.6 million to 98 organizations, with 90% providing multi-year support across three program areas: Informed Society, Nature and Living Environment, and Just and Equitable Society.
application_procedure: Contact Adessium Foundation directly through their website or email for initial inquiries. No open application process - funding decisions made through proactive identification and partnership development. Initial discussions to assess alignment with foundation priorities.
required_documents: For partnership discussions: Organization profile and mission alignment, Project overview and objectives, Organizational capacity and track record, Budget overview and sustainability, Impact measurement approach, Previous collaboration experience
additional_requirements: Focus on organizations in Netherlands and Europe. Must work on informed society, environmental sustainability, or social justice. Preference for multi-year partnerships and organizations with proven track record.
language_requirements: Applications accepted in English and Ukrainian. All supporting documents must be translated if in other languages.
reporting_requirements: Annual progress reports, financial accountability documentation, impact measurement with societal change indicators, partnership review meetings, final evaluation with lessons learned
evaluation_criteria: Partnerships evaluated on: Alignment with foundation program areas, Potential for societal impact, Organizational effectiveness and leadership, Innovation and sustainability, Contribution to free, sustainable, just society, Long-term partnership potential

detailed_description: Deutsche Welle Akademie (DW Akademie) is Germany leading organization for international media development. They provide grants, training, and technical assistance to strengthen independent media, promote press freedom, and support media literacy worldwide.
application_procedure: Submit applications through DW Akademie online portal or direct contact. Initial project concept followed by detailed proposal development. Regular funding rounds with specific deadlines for different program areas.
required_documents: Application materials include: Detailed project proposal, Organizational background and registration, Budget breakdown and justification, Work plan and timeline, Letters of endorsement, Previous project experience documentation
additional_requirements: Must be registered media organization or media support NGO. Projects should strengthen independent journalism, media literacy, or digital security. German development cooperation compliance required.
language_requirements: Applications accepted in English and Ukrainian. All supporting documents must be translated if in other languages.
reporting_requirements: Monthly progress reports, quarterly financial statements, semi-annual narrative reports, annual impact evaluations, final project documentation with best practices
evaluation_criteria: Projects assessed on: Alignment with media development goals, Technical quality and innovation, Organizational capacity and experience, Cost-effectiveness and budget realism, Sustainability and long-term impact, Partnership potential

detailed_description: The Westminster Foundation for Democracy (WFD) is a UK-based organization that supports democracy and governance worldwide. They provide funding and technical assistance to strengthen democratic institutions and civil society organizations.
application_procedure: Contact WFD directly through their website at wfd.org or their London office. Application procedures may vary by program. Initial inquiries should be made through their official contact channels.
required_documents: Typical requirements include: Organization registration documents, Project proposal, Budget breakdown, Organizational capacity information, Letters of recommendation
additional_requirements: Must be registered civil society organization or democratic institution. Project must align with WFD democracy promotion objectives.
language_requirements: Applications accepted in English and Ukrainian. All supporting documents must be translated if in other languages.
reporting_requirements: Regular progress reports, financial accountability, final project report with impact assessment
evaluation_criteria: Projects evaluated based on: Alignment with WFD priorities, Impact potential, Organizational capacity, Sustainability, Innovation in democratic development

detailed_description: The National Democratic Institute (NDI) is a nonprofit organization working to support and strengthen democratic institutions worldwide. NDI provides grants and technical assistance to civil society organizations, political parties, and civic groups to advance democratic governance.
application_procedure: Submit proposals through NDI online system at ndi.org. Initial letters of inquiry followed by full proposal submission. Multi-stage review process with technical and programmatic evaluation.
required_documents: Application requirements include: Detailed project proposal, Organizational profile and registration, Project budget and narrative, Work plan with milestones, Letters of recommendation, Financial statements
additional_requirements: Must be registered civil society organization. Projects must contribute to democratic development. Compliance with donor regulations and NDI policies required.
language_requirements: Applications accepted in English and Ukrainian. All supporting documents must be translated if in other languages.
reporting_requirements: Quarterly progress and financial reports, annual project reviews, final comprehensive report with lessons learned and impact assessment
evaluation_criteria: Applications assessed on: Strategic alignment with NDI objectives, Technical feasibility, Organizational capacity, Cost-effectiveness, Sustainability and impact potential, Innovation

focus_areas: Multiparty dialogue, democracy education, inclusive politics
detailed_description: This grant program focuses on strengthening democratic institutions, promoting civic participation, and supporting democratic governance. It aims to empower civil society organizations working on electoral processes, government accountability, transparency initiatives, and citizen engagement. The program supports projects that advance democratic values, human rights protection, and rule of law.
application_procedure:
1. Check application deadline and prepare early
2. Attend information session (if available)
3. Develop full proposal with required documents
4. Submit before deadline via online portal
5. Await review decision (6-8 weeks)
6. If selected, enter contracting phase
7. Attend grantee orientation
required_documents: Organization registration certificate; Audited financial statements (last 2 years); Project proposal (using template); Detailed budget with budget narrative; CVs of key project personnel; Letters of support from partners; Organizational chart and governance structure; Previous project reports (if applicable); Bank account details and verification
additional_requirements: Long-term strategic vision. Theory of change documentation. Partnership and collaboration strategy. Capacity building components.
language_requirements: Applications accepted in English and Ukrainian. All supporting documents must be translated if in other languages.
reporting_requirements: Monthly progress reports, quarterly financial reports, annual external audit, detailed M&E data, case studies
evaluation_criteria: Alignment with program objectives (25%); Technical approach and methodology (20%); Organizational capacity and experience (20%); Budget efficiency and cost-effectiveness (15%); Sustainability and impact potential (10%); Innovation and creativity (5%); Partnerships and collaboration (5%)
eligibility_criteria_uk: Political parties та civic groups

additional_requirements: Must be legitimate civil society organization or democratic institution. Projects must align with IRI democratic development goals. Compliance with US regulations required.

reporting_requirements: Monthly progress reports, quarterly financial reports, annual narrative reports, final project evaluation and impact assessment

grant_name: British Council - Connections Through Culture Grants 2025
country_region: United Kingdom and selected countries including Ukraine.
eligibility_criteria: Artists, creative practitioners, arts and cultural organisations, hubs, networks, and collectives. Individual applicants should be nationals living inside one of the listed participating countries (including Ukraine) or UK individuals living/working in the UK. Organization applicants should be registered in the UK or one of the listed participating countries. Collaboration between UK and partner country entities is central.
focus_areas: Collaborative artistic and cultural projects (digital, face-to-face, and/or hybrid formats). Art forms include: Architecture, design & fashion (including craft); Creative technology (incl. games, XR, immersive tech); Film; Literature; Music; Theatre and dance; Visual arts. Cross-art form projects and projects with themes relevant to the creative economy, diversity, and inclusion, or climate action are welcomed. For Ukraine, specific attention to risk management, security, and shelter access for in-person events is required.
grant_amount: Up to GBP 10,000 for collaborative projects between the UK and Ukraine. (Equivalent to approx. €11,800 as of early June 2025).
duration: Projects are expected to start from October 2025. Duration is project-based.
detailed_description: Collaborative artistic and cultural projects (digital, face-to-face, and/or hybrid formats). Art forms include: Architecture, design & fashion (including craft); Creative technology (incl. games, XR, immersive tech); Film; Literature; Music; Theatre and dance; Visual arts. Cross-art form projects and projects with themes relevant to the creative economy, diversity, and inclusion, or climate action are welcomed. For Ukraine, specific attention to risk management, security, and shelter access for in-person events is required.
contact_person: Via the application portal. Information sessions were held in May 2025. Application toolkit and FAQs are available on the website.
language_requirements: Online application form. Likely English, as materials are provided in English.
geographic_focus: United Kingdom and selected countries including Ukraine.

funding_organization: United Nations Industrial Development Organization (UNIDO) and Global Environment Facility (GEF). Implemented in Ukraine by Greencubator (Ukrainian NGO).
country_region: Ukraine (part of a global program in 17 countries).
eligibility_criteria: Clean technology startups and micro-, small, and medium-sized enterprises (MSMEs) in Ukraine. Requires a competent, established team, at least one Ukrainian co-founder, a finished product with first customers, willingness to actively participate in accelerator sessions, and basic English proficiency (B2 or higher).
focus_areas: Innovations in energy efficiency, renewable energy sources, waste recycling/beneficiation, water efficiency/conservation, green transportation, environmentally friendly/green buildings, advanced materials & chemicals. The program aims to reduce greenhouse gas emissions, improve energy efficiency, develop a circular economy, and adapt society to climate change.
grant_amount: Grant support of up to $USD 20,000 for the most successful teams participating in the acceleration program. The program also provides acceleration services, mentoring, and networking.
application_deadline: June 23, 2025 (23:59 CEST) for the GCIP Ukraine 2025 acceleration program..6
duration: The acceleration program lasts for 14 weeks (3 months of training).
website_link: GCIP Ukraine Country Page (for application) and Greencubator GCIP Page (for program details).

grant_name: IOM Hungary - Call for Implementing Partners (Assistance to Refugees from Ukraine)
country_region: Hungary (Projects targeting refugees from Ukraine in Hungary).
eligibility_criteria: Governmental agencies, government-owned/controlled corporations, IGOs, IOs, NGOs, non-profit agencies (including nonprofit KFT, nonprofit RT), ICSOs, or civil society organizations. Must have technical expertise, operational capacity, and local presence.
focus_areas: Providing life-saving assistance to refugees from Ukraine in Hungary. Specific areas/activities to be detailed in proposals, aligning with IOM Hungary's strategic objectives (humanitarian assistance, access to essential services, specialized protection). Emphasis on shelter, basic non-food items, and shelter improvements.
grant_amount: Project proposals should include a budget within the range of 10,000,000 to 40,000,000 Hungarian Forints (HUF) (Approx. €25,000 - €100,000).
duration: Activities must be completed on or before December 31, 2025.

Emphasis on shelter, basic non-food items, and shelter improvements.

language_requirements: All applications must be submitted in English and follow the prescribed format.

detailed_description: This grant program focuses on strengthening democratic institutions, promoting civic participation, and supporting democratic governance. It aims to empower civil society organizations working on electoral processes, government accountability, transparency initiatives, and citizen engagement. The program supports projects that advance democratic values, human rights protection, and rule of law.
application_procedure:
1. Check application deadline and prepare early
2. Attend information session (if available)
3. Develop full proposal with required documents
4. Submit before deadline via online portal
5. Await review decision (6-8 weeks)
6. If selected, enter contracting phase
7. Attend grantee orientation
required_documents: Organization registration certificate; Audited financial statements (last 2 years); Project proposal (using template); Detailed budget with budget narrative; CVs of key project personnel; Letters of support from partners; Organizational chart and governance structure; Previous project reports (if applicable); Bank account details and verification
additional_requirements: Long-term strategic vision. Theory of change documentation. Partnership and collaboration strategy. Capacity building components.
language_requirements: Applications accepted in English and Ukrainian. All supporting documents must be translated if in other languages.
reporting_requirements: Monthly progress reports, quarterly financial reports, annual external audit, detailed M&E data, case studies
evaluation_criteria: Alignment with program objectives (25%); Technical approach and methodology (20%); Organizational capacity and experience (20%); Budget efficiency and cost-effectiveness (15%); Sustainability and impact potential (10%); Innovation and creativity (5%); Partnerships and collaboration (5%)

grant_name: Open Society Foundations - Ukraine Democracy Fund / General Grantmaking
funding_organization: Open Society Foundations (OSF) (operates in Ukraine via International Renaissance Foundation (IRF))
eligibility_criteria: Primarily organizations (movements, coalitions, networks, CSOs). OSF awards grants to entities whose values and work align with OSF's mission. The vast majority of grants are awarded to organizations OSF approaches directly, but some open opportunities are occasionally listed. IRF is the national foundation in Ukraine.
focus_areas: Promoting democratic practice, advancing rights and human dignity, equitable governance. Specific to Ukraine: supporting civil society in the context of war, accountable government decision-making, advocacy for people affected by the invasion, veteran reintegration, anti-corruption, education reform, legal aid.
grant_amount: Varies greatly. OSF has committed an initial $USD 25 million to the Ukraine Democracy Fund (matched by other funders, total $USD 50M). Total OSF grants in Ukraine since 1990 exceed $USD 240M. Individual grant amounts are not specified for open calls.
application_deadline: Most grants are by invitation. For open calls, deadlines are specified if available. As of June 7, 2025, no specific open calls for Ukrainian CSOs were explicitly detailed in the provided general OSF funding pages. Monitoring IRF's website (irf.ua) and OSF's grant pages is recommended.

grant_name: National Endowment for Democracy (NED) Regular Grants
country_region: International, including Ukraine. NED funds programs in over 100 countries.
eligibility_criteria: Non-governmental organizations (e.g., civic organizations, associations, independent media). NED does not make grants to individuals, governmental bodies, or state-supported institutions like public universities. All projects must align with NED's Statement of Principles and Objectives.
focus_areas: Promoting and defending human rights and the rule of law; supporting freedom of information and independent media; strengthening democratic ideas and values; promoting accountability and transparency; strengthening civil society organizations; strengthening democratic political processes and institutions; promoting civic education; supporting democratic conflict resolution; promoting freedom of association; strengthening a broad-based market economy.
grant_amount: Not specified in the general call; grant amounts vary considerably depending on the project's size and scope. (Historically, average NED grants globally are around $USD 50,000, but this is a general figure not specific to Ukraine in the provided information).
application_deadline: NED has quarterly proposal submission deadlines. The deadlines listed for the 2024-2025 cycle were September 3, 2024, January 28, 2025, and May 20, 2025. Proposals submitted after a deadline are considered at the following Board Meeting. The next likely deadline post-May 2025 would be approximately September 2025, pending NED's official schedule update.
duration: Project-based, typically 12 months, but can vary.
detailed_description: Promoting and defending human rights and the rule of law; supporting freedom of information and independent media; strengthening democratic ideas and values; promoting accountability and transparency; strengthening civil society organizations; strengthening democratic political processes and institutions; promoting civic education; supporting democratic conflict resolution; promoting freedom of association; strengthening a broad-based market economy.
contact_person: For proposals concerning Europe (including Ukraine): europeproposals@ned.org. General inquiries can also be directed through their website.
language_requirements: Proposal narratives can be prepared in English or the applicant's local language. Application forms (Organizational Profile, Proposal Form) are in English. Budget template is an Excel file.
geographic_focus: International, including Ukraine. NED funds programs in over 100 countries.

grant_name: Reporters Sans Frontières Emergency Assistance Program
eligibility_criteria: Journalists, media organizations, especially those facing persecution or in exile
focus_areas: Press freedom, journalist safety, digital security, emergency assistance for displaced journalists
detailed_description: Reporters Sans Frontières (RSF) Emergency Assistance Program provides urgent financial support to journalists and media workers facing threats, persecution, or emergency situations. The program focuses on rapid response funding for exiled and displaced journalists worldwide.
application_procedure: Emergency assistance requests can be submitted through RSF contact channels. Applications reviewed on urgent basis with priority given to immediate safety threats. Direct contact with RSF regional offices or emergency hotline recommended.
required_documents: Emergency assistance requires: Description of immediate threat or situation, Journalist identity verification, Supporting documentation of incident, Location and contact information, Urgency assessment
additional_requirements: Must be working journalist or media worker. Cases must involve press freedom violations, threats, or emergency situations requiring immediate assistance. Priority given to life-threatening situations.
program_type: Emergency assistance, digital security support, press freedom advocacy
target_beneficiaries: Journalists, media organizations, exiled and displaced journalists
language_requirements: Applications accepted in English and Ukrainian. All supporting documents must be translated if in other languages.
reporting_requirements: Emergency response updates, safety status reports, assistance utilization documentation, follow-up security assessments, case outcome reporting
evaluation_criteria: Applications evaluated on: Immediate threat level, Journalist verification, Case urgency, Available emergency funds, Potential for successful assistance, Security considerations

detailed_description: Urgent Action Fund for Women Human Rights provides fast, flexible rapid response grants to women, trans, and non-binary activists worldwide. Operating in 131 countries, they have awarded  million since 1997 through over 4,000 rapid response grants supporting feminist movements and social change.

required_documents: Grant applications require: Project description and urgency rationale, Organization or individual activist background, Budget breakdown and timeline, Risk assessment and security considerations, References and support letters
additional_requirements: Must be women, trans, or non-binary activists or organizations. Focus on feminist movements and women human rights. Priority given to activists in Global South and marginalized communities. Emergency situations prioritized.
language_requirements: Applications accepted in English and Ukrainian. All supporting documents must be translated if in other languages.

detailed_description: V-Dem Institute (Varieties of Democracy) Internship Program offers research and academic opportunities to students and young professionals interested in democracy studies. application_procedure: Apply through V-Dem Institute website internship portal. Submit application including CV, academic transcripts, statement of interest, and references. Rolling applications with specific deadlines for different program periods.
required_documents: Application requirements: Completed application form, Academic CV and transcripts, Statement of interest and research goals, Two letters of recommendation, Writing samples or research portfolio
additional_requirements: Must be enrolled student or recent graduate. Background in political science, economics, or related field preferred. English proficiency required. Some positions may require specific regional expertise or language skills.
geographical_scope: In-person at University of Gothenburg, Sweden
language_requirements: Advanced English fluency (Arabic, French, Portuguese, Spanish, Russian beneficial)
reporting_requirements: Weekly activity reports, research project deliverables, final internship report with findings, evaluation feedback, academic credit documentation if applicable
evaluation_criteria: Applications evaluated on: Academic excellence and relevant coursework, Research interest alignment with V-Dem projects, Previous research experience, Language skills, Commitment to democracy studies

funding_organization: Government of Ukraine (via State Employment Center and Ministry of Economy)
eligibility_criteria: Individuals planning to register as Private Entrepreneurs (FOP), existing FOPs, and legal entities. Ineligible if located/operating in temporarily occupied territories, operating in Russia, under sanctions, bankrupt, prosecuted for corruption, have tax arrears, or involved in specific excluded activities (weapons, alcohol, tobacco, currency exchange, financial institutions). For the "Vlasna Sprava for Youth" sub-component, entrepreneurs up to 25 years old can receive up to UAH 150,000; job creation is not mandatory, but FOP registration is.

focus_areas: Poverty alleviation, social innovation, evidence-based solutions
detailed_description: Global Innovation Fund backs scalable solutions to pressing development challenges. Since 2015, they have invested $123M, backed 75 innovations, and expect to benefit 156 million people by 2033. They provide funding across multiple stages from early-stage innovations to scaling proven solutions.
application_procedure: Apply during open application windows published on GIF website. Last window closed January 15, 2025. Review funding guidance, stages, and requirements before applying. Multi-stage application process with rigorous evaluation and due diligence.
required_documents: Applications require: Innovation description and development challenge addressed, Evidence of impact and scalability potential, Budget and financial projections, Team and organizational capacity, Market analysis and sustainability plan, Risk assessment and mitigation strategy
additional_requirements: Must address pressing development challenges with scalable solutions. Strong evidence of effectiveness required. Innovations should have potential to benefit millions of people in developing countries. Various funding stages available.
language_requirements: Applications accepted in English and Ukrainian. All supporting documents must be translated if in other languages.
reporting_requirements: Regular progress reports with impact metrics, financial reporting and accountability, milestone achievement documentation, scaling progress updates, final evaluation with lessons learned and impact assessment
evaluation_criteria: Innovations evaluated on: Scale of development challenge addressed, Evidence of effectiveness and impact, Scalability and market potential, Team and organizational capacity, Financial sustainability and business model, Cost-effectiveness and value for money
eligibility_criteria_uk: Організації та підприємства з інноваційними рішеннями для подолання бідності та покращення життя людей у країнах з низьким та середнім рівнем доходу; повинні мати доказову базу впливу
focus_areas_uk: Подолання бідності, соціальні інновації, рішення на основі доказів
grant_amount_uk: 50 000 - 15 мільйонів доларів США залежно від стадії інновації
duration_uk: Різна, залежно від проєкту (від пілотних до масштабних проєктів)
application_procedure_uk: Онлайн-заявка через вебсайт; попередня перевірка ідеї; детальна заявка для відібраних проєктів
required_documents_uk: Опис інновації, доказова база, бізнес-модель, команда, бюджет, план впливу та оцінки
evaluation_criteria_uk: Інноваційність рішення, потенціал впливу, масштабованість, команда, економічна ефективність, доказова база
additional_requirements_uk: Фокус на країнах з низьким та середнім рівнем доходу; підхід на основі доказів; вимірювання впливу
reporting_requirements_uk: Регулярні звіти про прогрес, фінансова звітність, оцінка впливу, навчання та висновки
detailed_description_uk: Глобальний інноваційний фонд інвестує в соціальні інновації, які мають потенціал покращити життя мільйонів людей у країнах, що розвиваються. Фонд підтримує інновації на всіх стадіях - від ранніх пілотних проєктів до масштабування перевірених рішень. Особлива увага приділяється інноваціям з сильною доказовою базою та потенціалом для значного соціального впливу.
description_en: Global Innovation Fund backs scalable solutions to pressing development challenges. Since 2015, they have invested $123M, backed 75 innovations, and expect to benefit 156 million people by 2033. They provide funding across multiple stages from early-stage innovations to scaling proven solutions.

focus_areas: Media business development, loans, technical assistance
detailed_description: Media Development Investment Fund (MDIF) provides debt and equity financing to independent media companies worldwide. They support media that provides diverse news and facilitates information exchange, currently managing .7 million in assets across 50 countries with investments in 155 media companies.
application_procedure: Apply through MDIF online financing application system at mdif.org. Submit business plan and financial projections. Multi-stage due diligence process including technical, financial, and editorial independence assessment.
required_documents: Application requirements: Business plan and strategy, Financial statements and projections, Market analysis, Management team profiles, Editorial policy statement, Registration and legal documents, Reference letters
additional_requirements: Must be independent media company (digital startups or multi-platform broadcasters). Commitment to editorial freedom required. Focus on media that holds powerful entities accountable and exposes corruption.
language_requirements: Applications accepted in English and Ukrainian. All supporting documents must be translated if in other languages.
reporting_requirements: Monthly financial reports, quarterly business reviews, annual impact assessments, editorial independence compliance reports, strategic planning updates
evaluation_criteria: Investments evaluated on: Business viability and financial sustainability, Editorial independence and quality, Market opportunity and competition, Management team experience, Social impact potential, Risk assessment

focus_areas: Gender-based violence prevention, women's economic empowerment, feminist movements
detailed_description: Global Fund for Women Ukraine provides funding to support gender justice movements and women-led organizations worldwide, with specific support for Ukrainian initiatives. They work to advance gender equality and support women human rights defenders and feminist movements globally.
application_procedure: Submit applications through Global Fund for Women online portal. Regular application cycles with specific deadlines. Initial eligibility assessment followed by full proposal review for qualifying organizations. Rapid response funding available for emergencies.
required_documents: Grant applications require: Organization profile and mission statement, Project proposal with gender justice focus, Detailed budget and timeline, Impact measurement framework, Organizational registration documents, Letters of recommendation
additional_requirements: Must be women-led or women-focused organization. Clear commitment to gender equality and women human rights required. Priority given to grassroots organizations and movements led by marginalized women.
language_requirements: Applications accepted in English and Ukrainian. All supporting documents must be translated if in other languages.
reporting_requirements: Quarterly progress reports, financial reports with documentation, annual impact assessments, final project evaluation, contribution to gender justice movement analysis
evaluation_criteria: Proposals evaluated on: Alignment with gender justice priorities, Women leadership and participation, Innovation and effectiveness, Organizational capacity, Sustainability plan, Potential for systemic change

detailed_description: AWID (Association for Women Rights in Development) Feminist Movement Support provides funding and resources to strengthen feminist organizations and movements worldwide. They focus on resourcing feminist movements to achieve gender justice and women human rights globally.
application_procedure: Contact AWID through their website or membership portal. Applications vary by funding program and geographic focus. Initial engagement through AWID membership or movement building activities often required.
required_documents: Support applications typically require: Organization profile and feminist mission statement, Project proposal and objectives, Budget and resource needs, Organizational capacity documentation, Letters of support from movement partners
additional_requirements: Must be feminist organization or women rights group. Clear commitment to gender justice and intersectional feminism required. Priority given to organizations led by women from Global South and marginalized communities.
language_requirements: Applications accepted in English and Ukrainian. All supporting documents must be translated if in other languages.
reporting_requirements: Regular movement building updates, program impact reports, feminist organizing documentation, final evaluation with movement impact assessment, knowledge sharing with AWID network
evaluation_criteria: Support decisions based on: Alignment with feminist movement priorities, Organizational commitment to gender justice, Impact potential for women rights, Innovation in feminist organizing, Sustainability and movement building capacity

detailed_description: Comic Relief International is a UK-based charity that tackles poverty and social injustice through funding and awareness campaigns. They support projects focusing on international development, domestic programs, and emergency response, working to create lasting change for vulnerable communities worldwide.
application_procedure: Apply through Comic Relief online application system. Check website for current funding rounds and open applications. Multi-stage process with initial eligibility check, full application, and due diligence review. Regular funding cycles with specific themes and geographic focus.
required_documents: Application requirements include: Project proposal with clear outcomes, Organizational profile and registration, Detailed budget and value for money analysis, Risk assessment and mitigation plan, Monitoring and evaluation framework, Letters of support
additional_requirements: Must be registered charity or recognized civil society organization. Projects should focus on poverty alleviation, social justice, or emergency response. Strong emphasis on working with marginalized communities and achieving lasting change.
language_requirements: Applications accepted in English and Ukrainian. All supporting documents must be translated if in other languages.
reporting_requirements: Quarterly progress reports, annual financial reports, impact measurement documentation, final evaluation with lessons learned, beneficiary feedback and case studies, safeguarding compliance reports
evaluation_criteria: Applications evaluated on: Alignment with Comic Relief priorities, Evidence of need and impact potential, Organizational capacity and track record, Value for money and cost-effectiveness, Innovation and sustainability, Beneficiary involvement and feedback
eligibility_criteria_uk: Зареєстровані благодійні організації та некомерційні організації, що працюють з дітьми, молоддю та вразливими групами

evaluation_criteria_uk: Вплив на найбільш вразливі групи, інноваційність, партнерський підхід, сталість
additional_requirements_uk: Сильні політики захисту дітей та вразливих груп; інклюзивний підхід

Організація фокусується на підтримці місцевих рішень глобальних проблем.

eligibility_criteria: Organizations from Visegrad countries (Czech Republic, Hungary, Poland, Slovakia) partnering with organizations from Eastern Partnership countries (Armenia, Azerbaijan, Belarus, Georgia, Moldova, Ukraine) or Western Balkans countries
focus_areas: Democratization, transformation processes, civil society cooperation
grant_amount: €25,000-€35,000 typical range, covers up to 100% of project budget, maximum 15% for overheads
application_deadline: Three annual deadlines: February 1, June 1, and October 1 at 12:00 PM (noon) CET
detailed_description: This civil society support program strengthens the capacity of non-governmental organizations and community groups. It funds organizational development, advocacy initiatives, coalition building, and projects that enhance civic space and promote citizen participation in public affairs.
contact_person: Consultation team available via My Visegrad portal
application_procedure: Submit proposals via My Visegrad portal (my.visegradfund.org). Consultation available via email, phone, or meetings (maximum two consultations per project). Consultation must be completed no later than 14 days before application deadline. Applications require completion of application form template and adherence to grant guidelines.
required_documents: Application Form Template (DOCX), Draft proposal including project goal, proposed solution, planned activities, project partners, target groups, and estimated budget. Grant Guidelines must be followed.
additional_requirements: Must involve 3 V4 countries and 1 Eastern Partnership or Western Balkans country. Project must be implemented in EaP or Western Balkans regions. Maximum project duration: 18 months.
target_beneficiaries: CSOs from V4 countries working with Western Balkans and Eastern Partnership
geographical_scope: Eastern Partnership countries and Western Balkans
language_requirements: Applications accepted in English and Ukrainian. All supporting documents must be translated if in other languages.
reporting_requirements: Standard project reporting required (detailed requirements in Grant Guidelines)
evaluation_criteria: Projects evaluated based on: involvement of 3 V4 countries + 1 Eastern Partnership or Western Balkans country, implementation in EaP/Western Balkans regions, alignment with focus areas (Culture, Education, Innovation, Democratic Values, Public Policy, Regional Development, Social Development), project feasibility and budget appropriateness.

Individual grant amounts under these umbrella announcements will vary per specific call on the portal.

detailed_description: IREX Media Support Ukraine provides funding and technical assistance to strengthen independent media and civil society in Ukraine. The program supports journalism, media literacy, and democratic participation through various grant mechanisms.

7. Attend grantee orientation
